thread.title: Millburn High School varsity boys soccer team edges diivison rival
thread.title_full: Millburn High School varsity boys soccer team edges diivison rival

title: Millburn High School varsity boys soccer team edges diivison rival
text:
Millburn High School varsity boys soccer team edges diivison rival October 8, 2015 Last updated: Thursday, October 8, 2015, 12:32 AM The Item of Millburn and Short Hills Buy this photo staff photo by jim connelly Millburn High School’s Raghav Pant controls the ball Oct. 5 during the waning moments of a 2-1 defeat of Super Essex Conference, American Division rival Montclair Kimberley Academy. At left is teammate Logan Schneider (23). 
Scores of 2-1 have become the norm this season for Millburn High School’s varsity boys soccer team. 
The Millers posted a second consecutive victory by that result Oct. 5, edging Super Essex Conference, American Division rival Montclair Kimberley Academy in the local squad’s final regular season home match. 
Senior forward Jeff Plump accounted for both Millburn (3-5-1, 3-5 American Division) goals. 
The Millers withstood a late goal by the Cougars (2-5, 1-5 American Division) to prevail for the third time in their past four outings. 
Junior midfielder Matt Brenner and senior defender Sean Klein each collected an assist for Millburn. 
Millburn received four saves from senior keeper Alex Tomko and two from junior keeper Perry Schwartz. 
The triumph came on the heels of a 2-1 win over division rival Nutley High School Oct. 2 on a rainy evening at Millburn High School’s Dr. Keith A. Neigel Field. 
Junior midfielder Drew Cohn accounted for both Miller goals. 
Sophomore midfielder Ben Kessler set up both Cohn goals. 
MILLER NOTES 
All but one of the team’s matches, entering a scheduled Oct. 7 match at division rival West Orange School, ended 2-1. 
The Millers opened the season with four consecutive losses by that score before posting a 2-2 tie with visiting Bloomfield High School Sept. 25 on Senior Night. 
-Jim Connelly © 2015 North Jersey Media Group Tags:
